Bellevue.More Hall Annex:
The More Hall Annex, formerly the Nuclear Reactor Building, was a building on the campus of the University of Washington (UW) in Seattle, Washington, that once housed a functional nuclear research reactor. It was inaugurated in 1961 and shut down in 1988, operating at a peak of 100 kilowatts thermal (kWt), and was officially decommissioned two decades later in 2007.
The reactor was housed in a reinforced concrete building designed in the Brutalist architectural style by UW faculty members.
